I'm probably being stupid here, but pinging @DmitryUlyanov to explain the difference between instance normalisation and layer normalisation (if indeed there is any). Is it that instance norm gives each channel a mean and std dev, whereas layer norm gives the entire layer (so normalising over channels too) a mean and std dev? If so then instance norm is the way that batch norm was extended to spatial inputs, whilst the authors of layer norm did a naive application to spatial inputs and hence didn't get any good results?

If I'm correct then we should probably just have a doc change which notes that InstanceNorm1d is LayerNorm, and InstanceNorm{2,3}d are what I described above?
